Septic falcon you are one of the only people whose opinion i respect regarding dayz and i would like to see if you agree with me on this point The single biggest mistake the dayZ development team ever made wa not adding a rideable bicycle a a very common item within the first year or 2 of development The reason i say this is because the vast majority of the 40K player that played dayz only played around the coast because it wa simply too time consuming to go to the northern part of the map and if they did they ONLY went to an airfield or high military loot zone effectively making roughly 40 of the map PURE DEAD CONTENT Dead content that make the game harder to run I feel a though the devs were so prideful about their vision for dayz and what it would be in the future that they never bothered to atleast make the CURRENT BUILD OF THE GAME more enjoyable to play there wa very rarely a quality of life change and yes i do understand how game developing work regarding alpha and beta stage but the fact that dayZ s player base wnt from FORTY THOUSAND to eighteen hundred maybe it time to throw the playbook out the window I am 100 CERTAIN that if that simple change wa implemented dayz would have a significant more amount player on daily Sadly enough though it a case of too little too late Not to say Dayz is dead but it certainly will never be the sensation that it wa a damn near social experiment of a game with 40 thousand player They had the chance to be something more and their vision for the future blinded them to the problem of the present I know that s allot of text but if you could give me you honest thought i would really appreciate it i am very passionate about dayz a i ve been playing since the mod wa in it infancy in 2011 it been a big part of my life and i am saddened at the current state of it to say the very least It is nothing like it once wa it a if the game devs are seeking a different audience than the one that gave DAYZ it name
